Tule.Slo:

Kerndoel 48 Oriëntatie op jezelf en op de wereld, ruimte

Kinderen leren over de maatregelen die in Nederland genomen worden/werden om bewoning van door water bedreigde gebieden mogelijk te maken.

IPC:

MP3 Thema: Nederland Waterland

Natuur 3.2
Leerlijngen zijn staat om wetenschappelijk onderzoek uit te voeren.

Aardrijkskunde 3.11
Leerlingen weten hoe mensen hun omgeving kunnen beïnvloeden door het inpolder van land, het veilig maken van woongebieden en het voeren van waterbeheer.

Leerlingen leren waar Nederland aanpassingen heeft gedaan tegen de invloeden van de zee. Daarnaast wat de invloed is geweest van de aanpassingen op het landschap.

Activiteit 1: Leerlingen leren types van overstromingen, oorzaken, gevolgen
Activiteit 2: Hoe gaat een rivier?
Activiteit 3: Wat kun je tegen een overstroming doen?
Activiteit 4: Leerlingen stellen en beantwoorden vragen over overstromingen.
Activiteit 5: Leerlingen maken een poster over veiligheid omtrent overstromingen
Activiteit 6: Leerlingen geven aan of stellingen over overstromingen waar of niet waar zijn.

Periods in the Dutch geological development

A short webquest about the main ways of protecting The Netherlands from major floodings.

Children read and search for information and they can do a quiz.

(http://apliense.xtec.cat/arc/sites/default/files/Dutch_Connection_teacher.pdf answers and tips page 31)

Name: Fly swatter or find your partner
Challenge: To be the first person to find the correct word/picture or find the partner for causes or solutions

Functional language:

Is this a cause or a solution? Are you sure? Well done that is the correct answer, You have won a point, No, that is incorrect, Remember that the cause of a flood can be by humans or nature, Remember a solution for a flood can be made by humans or nature.

Vocabulary:

flash flood, melting icewater, dams, drainage systems, forests, embankments, heavy rainfall, overflow, earthquake, storm, tropical cyclone, levees, river barriers, dam failure, melting snow, to deep the rivers, dredging, straighten rivers, strong wind in coastal areas, flood warnings, dam breaking, reservoirs, steep slopes, straighten channels, impermeable rock, saturated soils, flood gate, flood plain zoning, construct buildings above flood levels, compacted soil, dry soil, urbanisation, deforestation, overflow channels

Instructions
Two teams, a person from each team has a fly swatter. You say a word or give a clue and the first one from the team to swat the word gets a point for their team.

Description: The children learn about the causes and consequences of flooding. They also learn about the different types of floods.

Time needed: 40 mins

Kerndoel: 48 IPC: 3.2

Description:

Discuss with the students the causes of floods and how people can protect themselves against flood dangers. Because this activity includes opportunities for students to discuss with peers, the initial brainstorming of ideas can be done in Dutch in order to then feed back the information by the teacher, and with the help of word lists, in English.

Go through the slides of the Flood powerpoint (1) and whenever you see a question with a big question mark, let the students talk and think of answers in their groups (in Dutch). After about 5 minutes, discuss the suggestions the children came up with and go to the next slide to see if their answers are mentioned (in English) on the slide. Provide the children with word banks to help them with the difficult words (2).

As a round-up activity, ask the children to make a poster giving advice to people on how to stay safe in the event of a flood.

Functional language:

What is a flood?, What causes a flood?, What are the dangers of flooding?

Vocabulary:

flood, flooding, submerges, dangers, float, unstable, dangerous, hazards, contaminated, thogoughly, occur, heavy rain, flash floods, melting, to cause, overflow, drainiage systems, severe, suffered, exceptional (slides 15-17 not required to go into detail).

Time needed: 45 mins

Kerndoel: IPC:

Description: (Back to back Activity with a Partner.)

Put the pupils into pairs as they will need to do this activity with a partner, they need to decide if they are Student A or Student B. Print out the worksheets (1) and give them out to the pupils accordingly. It is essential that the pupils don't show their partner their sheet as otherwise the activity will not work! Open Prowise Presentation (2) and put the functional language up on the interactive whiteboard. For this activity the pupils will need to sit back to back. Student A starts by reading out the first few words on their sheet until they come to some blank spaces (What is a........). Student B needs to fill out these words (What is a) on their sheet using the lines to help them fill in the letters (1 line corresponds to 1 letter). Student B then needs to continue reading from their sheet (flood? A flood is an.........). Student A will write these words down on their sheet using the lines to help them. The functional language on the Prowise Presentation should be used to help the pupils ask each other questions e.g.How do you spell that?

Functional language:

How do you spell that?, Can you speak slower please?, Is that the end of the sentence?, Can you say that again please?, There is a full stop after the word......, There is a comma after the word......, There is a question mark after the word.......It's your turn to read, I can't go on any further.

Vocabulary:

flood, overflow, covers, land, usually, dry, develops, slowly, flash floods, signs, local, impacting, neighbour, community, affecting, entire, river basins.

kerndoel 53 Oriëntatie op jezelf en de wereld, tijd

De leerlingen leren over de belangrijke historische personen en gebeurtenissen uit de Nederlandse geschiedenis en kunnen die voorbeeldmatig verbinden met de wereldgeschiedenis.

IPC

MP3: Nederland waterland

Geschiedenis 3.10

Leerlingen zijn in staat om uit verschillende bronnen informatie over het verleden te vergaren

Geschiedenis 3.11

Leerlingen zijn in staat om redenen voor het droogleggen van stukken zee en de gevolgen van overstromingen aan te geven en te beschrijven

Geschiedenis 3.17

Leerlingen zijn in staat om de gebeurtenissen, mensen en veranderingen uit de behandelde perioden binnen een chronologisch kader te plaatsen

Leerlingen leren dat Nederland geconfronteerd is geweest met de invloed van de zee. Wat Nederland in de jaren heeft gedaan om bestand te zijn tegen de zee. Daarnaast dat in de wereld er soortgelijke ervaringen zijn.

Activiteit 1: Hoe was de overstroming in Gorichem? Wat gebeurde er voor en na?

Activiteit 2: Begrijpend lezen bekende personen die met waterhuishouding te maken hebben gehad.

Activiteit 3: Memory over belangrijke data rondom waterhuishouding.
When did the Netherlands experience flooding and what precautions did they take to protect themselves against the floods?

Time needed: 45 mins

Kerndoel: 53 IPC: 3.17

Description:

Children search the internet about floods in Gorichem. They make a timetable and describe the circumstances in that year. The start is a website called 'Gorichem the Key to Holland'. They are looking for more sites and facts.

Functional language: This is a chart of holland. At the bottom (top) or on the right (left) of the Netherlands, the land is below the sea level

Vocabulary: river delta area, dikes, pile, piling, prevention.

1 link 2 worksheet

Time needed: 45 min

Kerndoel: 53 IPC: 3.17

Description:

Reading comprehension. The children are reading two newspaper articles (1) about two famous Dutch engineers (Jan Adriaanszoon Leeghwater and Cornelis Lely) who have made their mark on Dutch history through their works in reclaiming land.

After reading the articles, children complete a Venn diagram (2) in which they note down the differences and similarities found in the two articles.

Teachers can chose to let the children work in small groups, pairs or on their own. For weaker groups it is advisable to read the text first together as a whole class activity and discuss difficult words and sentences.

Answers can be checked with the children (3) on the interacitve whiteboard but more options are possible.

Functional language: work in pairs, work in small groeps, work on your own, complete the Venn diagram, Note down similarities in the two articles.

Vocabulary:

Opposite, council, bust, confident voice, reclaimed land, impressed, engineer, carpenting, carpenter, brick layer, apologized (to aplogize), famous, once, statue, proud, faith, to protect, besides, governor

Description:

Children play a memory game about important dates in the history of the Dutch waterline. This is best done after the children have been familiarised with the dates and historic events in Dutch.

Functional language: Play a memory game about important dates in history, The Dutch people realized that water could be a defence against the enemies.

Vocabulary: memory, dates, historic events, important, Dutch waterline, dikes, water-based defence, construction, reconstruction.

Kerndoel 45 Oriëntatie op jezelf en op de wereld, natuur en techniek
De leerlingen leren oplossingen voor technische problemen te onderwerpen, deze uit te voeren en te evalueren.

IPC:
MP3 Thema: Nederland Waterland

Techniek 3.14

De leerlingen zijn in staat om informatie te vergaren en te verwerken die betrekking heeft op de hoogte van het land ten opzichte van de zeespiegel, het winnen van land op de zee, de eeuwige strijd tegen het water en het voeren van waterbeheer in Nederland

Techniek 3.15

De leerlingen zijn in staat om geografische patronen aan te wijzen die het gevolg zijn van inpolderingen en het aanleggen van zeeweringen; zij kunnen deze met hun kennis en inzicht verklaren

Techniek 3.16

De leerlingen zijn in staat om de juiste geografische terminologie te gebruiken om hun omgeving te beschrijven en te interpreteren

De leerlingen leren hoe dreigingen ontstaan vanuit de zee. Daarnaast leren de leerlingen hoe de aanpassingen werken die gemaakt zijn ter bescherming van de zee.

Activiteit 1 = Welke dammen kent Zeeland?

Activiteit 2 = Maak een huis wat bestand is tegen wateroverlast.

Time needed: 45 mins

Kerndoel: 45 IPC: 3.14, 3.15, 3.16

Description:

For this activity, children work as a team to design and make a model of a home able to withstand the effects of flooding...then test it by standing it in water and blasting it with a hose pipe!.

This activity encourages pupils to work as a team and enables them to take on specific roles within a group, such as team leader, designer, researcher or architect. Pupils also need to use knowledge from different disciplines such as geography, science and maths.

First watch the video (1) about some measures that have been put in place in a village in Bangladesh to protect them agains flooding. Discuss what the people have done and what materials have been used.

Next, ask the children to design and build a home that can withstand the effects of flooding (2). When they have designed their home they can start making it. Document (3) gives some ideas about the materials children can use or how to make the homes.

When all homes are finished, ask each group to present their home to the class. Focus on the language provided in the 'functional language' section. You can give this to the children or display it on the interactive whiteboard.

Materials needed:

  • Drinking straws
  • Modelling clay
  • Digital scales
  • Sticky tape
  • Hairdryer
  • Glue gun
  • Scissors

For more information visit http://www.scienceinschool.org/content/beat-flood#w2

Funtional language:

Our home is made of ....., We have chosen these materials because ..... , We think that this is a good/strong/waterproof model because .... , First we ... , Next we ... , Finally we ....

Vocabulary:

Plinths, vegetation, soggy, straw, bamboo, waterproof, flexible, bricks, roof, corrugated iron, buoyant, stilts, flood-proof.
